input:
M: What are you doing this Saturday, Gene? ,F: Well, first thing in the morning I'm going to take my driving test. ,M: Really? I thought you had a driver's license. ,F: No, I've never needed one. I've always lived in Boston and it's easy to get around on public transportation. But now I'm taking a job in Los Angeles. ,M: Congratulations. ,F: Thanks. But everyone knows that to live in LA you have to drive. So I've been taking lessons and I'm going to take my test tomorrow.
(A) M: Good luck! I didn't know you got a new job in San Francisco. (B) M: Good luck! When will you on board your new job? (C) M: Good luck! Are you going to buy a new car? I can go with you and maybe give you some advice. (D) M: I’m sorry, I didn’t understand. Could you repeat a little louder, please?

F: What a terrible house! ,M: I'm sick of it, too! ,F: The doorbell doesn't work, there's no hot water, and the building is so old that it seems to be falling apart.
(A) M: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please? (B) M: I caught a cold after taking a cold bath last night because there was no hot water. (C) M: There is no doorbell in this restaurant, you have to wait for the waiter to open the door for you. (D) M: There is no hot water in the kettle. You can get some from the kitchen.

M: Can you make a dentist appointment for me? I had a tooth pulled last month but now I'm having problems with another tooth. It hurts a lot. ,F: OK, I need to go to. I haven't seen the dentist in years and I really need my teeth cleaned.
(A) M: So you go to see the dentist just because your teeth need to be cleaned. (B) M: I heard you have checked your sore tooth by yourself. (C) M: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it. (D) M: So you go to see the dentist just because your husbend's teeth need to be cleaned.

F: What's your schedule like after school? ,M: I usually go to the gym on Thursdays and Saturdays. And on Wednesdays, I take guitar lessons in the evening at a music school.
(A) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t understand. Could you repeat a little louder, please? (B) F: It's ok you spend every Wednesday night learning guitar, but you should complete your homework. (C) F: You put guitar lessons and gym exercise all on Wednesdays. The schedule would be tight. (D) F: Your guitar lessons are on Saturdays. Busy weekends.

M: I can't find my car keys. I thought I left them in the bag. ,F: Look on the floor. Maybe you dropped them. ,M: They're not here, and they may still be inside the car. ,F: I'll look. You're right dad, here they are.
(A) M: Oh, no. How can we get our car keys out of the car? (B) M: Oh, the car keys are on the floor. (C) M: Excuse me, could you repeat the question? (D) M: Oh, no. How can we get our room keys out of the car?

M: Excuse me, can you help me? I am looking for the lecture hall. ,F: Actually, I'm looking for the lecture hall, too. I think it's in the library.
(A) M: Excuse me, could you repeat the question? (B) M: What do you want to buy? (C) M: How do you think of this film? (D) M: Yes, there is no lecture hall in this college.

F: In the shop, I thought this shirt was green. But out here in the sunlight, I see it's really blue. ,M: Yes, the bright yellow display lights in the shop make things look a little different, don't they?
(A) F: Yes, they do. It is a yellow shirt actually. (B) F: Yes, the blue lights makes it like a green shirt. (C) F: Yes, they do. It is a blue hat. (D) F: I am sorry. You spoke so rapidly that I did not catch the meaning of what you said. Could you repeat that?

M: At first, I thought this shirt was yellow, but now it looks green to me. ,F: You were right the first time. It's the blue light in the store that makes everything look different.
(A) M: Right, I like the light blue color of this shirt. (B) M: I guess so. This should be a beautiful authentic yellow shirt. (C) M: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Could you say it again? (D) M: I know it's because of the red lighting. It's doesn't look yellow at all now.

F: What is so special about tomorrow? ,M: Tomorrow is October the twenty-forth, United Nations Day.
(A) F: Excuse me, could you repeat the question? (B) F: Then today is October 22nd because tomorrow is October the twenty-third. (C) F: Although today is October 23rd, tomorrow is not special at all. (D) F: Since today is October 24th, tomorrow is not special at all.

M: I need to make a plane reservation. ,F: We can book your trip right now, what is your destination? ,M: I need to fly to New York City. ,F: What date would you like me to book this plane ticket for you? ,M: I need a flight on July fourth.
(A) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please? (B) F: So, your travel date is June 14th? Well, we can not book your trip right now. (C) F: So, you mean you need to fly to Beijing and your travel date is June 4th? (D) F: So, you mean you don't need any plane ticket, as your travel date is July 4th?

F: Oh no, I meant to call my mom, but it's too late to call today. ,M: Yeah, your mom lives in London. Not here in New York. There are 5 hours ahead of us, so it's already midnight there.
(A) F: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it. (B) F: It is 5:00 pm in New York. (C) F: It is 7:00 pm here. (D) F: It is 10:00 pm in New York.

F: David, I heard you had an unpleasant experience when you were on holiday in Florida. What happened exactly? ,M: We were having an enjoyable day out at a wildlife park and suddenly this lion started walking towards me. ,F: Oh, that must have been terrible. ,M: Yes, it was. I started running away as fast as I could and I didn't see where I was going. I ran into a tree and hit my head quite badly. ,F: Oh dear, you poor thing. And the lion? ,M: Luckily, one of the park keepers put it back in its cage and called for first aid. So nothing more serious happened. ,F: I'm pleased to hear that.
(A) M: I’m sorry, I didn’t understand. Could you repeat a little louder, please? (B) M: I just think that my trip in Tokyo is excited. (C) M: I just think that my trip in Tokyo is frightened. (D) M: I just think that my trip in Florida is frightened.

F: Wow, you look like a drowned rat. Didn't you know there's a thunderstorm today? ,M: I knew there would be a rain, but I didn't expect it would rain cats and dogs today.
(A) F: I am sorry to hear that you almost drowned himself. (B) F: I didn’t hear you. Please could you tell me again? (C) F: So you got wet in the storm yesterday, right? (D) F: Why did you get so wet in the storm?

F: This job is for 3 days a week. Monday, Friday and Saturday. Are you ok with that? ,M: Um, I was hoping to have Saturday free. But I need the job. So, can you tell me what exactly I will do?
(A) F: I am sorry. You spoke so rapidly that I did not catch the meaning of what you said. Could you repeat that? (B) F: Okay, thanks for taking the job. You need to do this job on Monday, Friday and Sunday. (C) F: Fine. Could you please tell me why you refuse the offer? You can work on Monday, Friday and Saturday, as you wish. (D) F: Okay, thanks for taking the job. You just need to check information on the computer.

F: May I leave before 11? I have something to buy for the office. ,M: But you have to hand in your work plan first.
(A) F: I didn’t hear you. Please could you tell me again? (B) F: Alright. I'll hand in as soon as possible, because I must go to buy the things before 9. (C) F: OK, and then I'll go to buy the things before 11. (D) F: OK. But I must leave before 11 no matter whether I could hand in my work plan or not, because I must go home on time.

F: Was there an accident on the highway today? ,M: You haven't heard about it? ,F: No, do you know what happened? ,M: A car knocked into a truck on the G45. But strangely enough, the truck turned over. ,F: Did anyone get hurt? ,M: Two people were injured. ,F: Well, it's unbelievable that no one was killed. ,M: Yes, they were lucky.
(A) F: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it. (B) F: It's not strange that the truck turned over. (C) F: It's strange that the truck turned over. (D) F: It's strange that no one was killed.

M: What did you do with your computer? ,F: Nothing, but it wouldn't work. ,M: I'm afraid we don't have anymore of these models. You can get a refund with your receipt.
(A) F: I am sorry. You spoke so rapidly that I did not catch the meaning of what you said. Could you repeat that? (B) F: Because I'm in the computer lab, so you have these models, right? (C) F: Since I'm in the computer store and you don't have these models, why can't you give me a refund? (D) F: You mean that although I'm in the computer store, you don't have these models, do you?

M: How about eating out tonight at the red rose restaurant? It's very near my house. ,F: It's too noisy there. How about the Blue Moon Restaurant? I like the soft music there. It's a much nicer environment for eating.
(A) M: Okay, let's go to the Blue Moon Restaurant to have lunch, as you wish. (B) M: Okay, let's go to the Blue Moon Restaurant, as you wish. (C) M: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Could you say it again? (D) M: Thanks for coming to my house for lunch.

F: Peter, do you live in the red house at the end of the road? ,M: Yes, I live in that house with my parents and my sister. And we also have a dog. ,F: Do you take your dog for a walk everyday? ,M: No, my father takes the dog for a walk on Sunday, and I take the dog for a walk on Friday. My mom and my sister walk him on the other workdays. ,F: Who walks the dog on Saturday? ,M: On Saturday, we all go to the park and the dog comes with us. ,F: Do you help with the housework? ,M: Yes. My mom and my sister do the laundry. My father does the cooking and I sweep the floor.
(A) F: Just a minute! I do not quite follow what you are saying, would you mind repeating that? (B) F: So you only cook food for your family? Good for you! (C) F: Oh, you always do the laundry with your mother. (D) F: So you sweep the floor but your sister does nothing?

F: I'm so angry with my result. ,M: Why? What happened? ,F: Well, I failed my Chinese oral test by 3%, and I worked so hard for it. ,M: Oh, no. Poor you.
(A) F: I was ill when I took the test, but I still passed. (B) F: I am so sad because I just lost my job. (C) F: I didn't know why I failed my English oral test. (D) F: Excuse me, could you repeat the question?

F: Hi, Sam. Would you like to come for Indian food with us next Friday? ,M: Sure. I love Indian food. Who else is coming? ,F: Jane, Susan, Pete and 2 colleagues of mine. ,M: I have no plans for Friday, so Indian food would be great. Which restaurant do you have in mind? ,F: Susan suggested the one on main street. She says it is very good. ,M: Which one is that? ,F: You know, the one just on the corner with Oxford Street. There is a large drug store next door.
(A) M: OK. I know the Chinese restaurant on Main Street. I will find it. (B) M: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch that. Would you mind speaking more slowly? (C) M: Sure. The Japanese restaurant is opposite a drugstore. (D) M: I know. The Japanese restaurant on Oxford Street is good.

F: Mike was injured this morning, did he have a car accident? ,M: No, what made you think so? ,F: He started driving only a week ago, so I thought he might have had a car accident. ,M: He got his driver's license 3 years ago, he is actually a skilled driver.
(A) F: Yeah, he got his drive license just a week ago, he shouldn't start driving. (B) F: He has driven two weeks but he got his license just three weeks ago. (C) F: Yeah, he got his license 3 years ago and started driving 2 years ago. (D) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please?

M: Call your mom and tell her that we will be home later than expected. ,F: Um, we are in the tunnel now and the mobile phones' signals are dead.
(A) M: How do you know that your mom is in the area with poor signal reception? We are not in the tunnel now. (B) M: Can't you make a phone to your mom now, telling her that we will be home earlier? (C) M: Excuse me, could you repeat the question? (D) M: Do you think we should tell mom that someone is dead, even though the mobile phones' signals are good?

F: Hi. How can we help you today? ,M: Yeah, I'd like to get my hair cut a little. ,F: Well, can we interest you in today's special? ,M: Um... nah, nah. ,F: We'll shampoo, cut and style your hair for one unbelievable low price of $9.99. Plus, we'll give you a clean shaved to help you relax. ,M: I just want to get my hair cut. A little of the top and sides. That's all.
(A) F: Cut and style your hair for one unbelievable low price of $9.99. (B) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch that. Would you mind speaking more slowly? (C) F: It costs you $7.99 only. (D) F: Cut your hair costs $9.9, and style it costs $19.

M: My son's just tried to book some tickets for the Black Key Concert on March twenty-first, but there's a problem with your website. ,F: I'm sorry about that. There are only the most expensive tickets left for that date, I'm afraid. ,M: What about the twentieth? Have you got any for $25? ,F: Sorry, those are all sold out. But there are some on the nineteenth, or there are $35 ones on the twentieth. ,M: Yes, those would be best. The nineteenth is no good because he's got school the next day.
(A) F: Okay, please give me $15 for the football game ticket. (B) F: It' s a good deal to pay $25 for the football game ticket. (C) F: I am sorry. You spoke so rapidly that I did not catch the meaning of what you said. Could you repeat that? (D) F: Sir, please give me $35 for the Black Key Concert ticket.

F: Hello, I'm from the students' union. We're doing a survey of students' eating habits. Would you mind if I ask you a few questions? ,M: Not at all.
(A) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t understand. Could you repeat a little louder, please? (B) F: Well, before doing that, I hope you remember that you should come to my office after class, I want to talk to you about your homework. (C) F: Alright, before doing that, I need you to give these documents to the accountant in the office. (D) F: Well, could you tell me how to get to the dormitory? Because now I am doing a survey of students' living habits.

F: Steven, do you have any friend in London? ,M: Yes, my old friend, Hanson, lives there working as a lawyer.
(A) F: Oh, I know. He is a lawyer in Manchester. (B) F: Oh. He is a very famous lawyer. (C) F: Oh, I know. He is a volunteer in Manchester. (D) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch that. Would you mind speaking more slowly?

M: Excuse me, Miss, is there a plane to New York? ,F: Uh, let me see. One just left half an hour ago and the next one will be in 2 hours.
(A) M: Thank you, since I want to go to Washington, I asked planes to Washington. (B) M: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch that. Would you mind speaking more slowly? (C) M: Since I asked about how to book a ticket to London, I'll take one. (D) M: Thank you. Is there anyone besides me asking about the plane to New York?

F: Let's eat out tonight. ,M: That's a good idea. How about an Italian meal? ,F: Good, I'd love to. What time shall we go? ,M: About 7:00 PM. I'll call you then.
(A) F: I don't like the country we're talking about, so I'm not going to eat Italian food tonight. (B) F: So we're going to have a Chinese meal tonight, right? (C) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please? (D) F: I don't like the trip to Italy we're talking about, so I'm not going to eat Italian food tonight.

M: How was the airplane ride yesterday? ,F: It couldn't be worse. It was a 12-hour flight and the couple sitting next to me kept talking all the time.
(A) M: Sure. Your airplane ride today was exciting. (B) M: It seems that your airplane ride today was terrible. (C) M: I am glad that you had a relaxing 10-hour flight. (D) M: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it.

F: 5,4,3,2,1. Here I come! Now, where could you be? Not under the table, not under the bed, not in the closet. There you are, behind the door. ,M: You found me, Mommy. Now, it's your turn to hide.
(A) F: You hid in the closet just now, which took me  an hour to find you. (B) F: I lost my keys yesterday and I found it behind the door at last. (C) F: Dad, I want to hide under the bed, which is hard to be found. (D) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please?

F: Eric, how long will you be in China? ,M: I don't know, well my contract here is for one year and I don't know what I should do after that, maybe going around for a while.
(A) F: You only study there for a semester? That's about half a year. (B) F: So you'll spend at least 6 months after the half-year contract. (C) F: That's at least one year. You should go around to more cities. (D) F: I didn’t hear you. Please could you tell me again?

F: Please be careful with this dress. This is my favorite. ,M: Madam, we're careful about everything here.
(A) F: Since you are in the department store, why are you so careless about everything here? (B) F: Since we are in the post office, why are we so careless about my dress? (C) F: OK, although I believe in this dry cleaner, you are not careful about everything here. (D) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please?

F: Ted, it's really you? I just cannot believe it! You've really put on some weight. ,M: Yeah, that's true. Actually, I'm losing weight now. Now I go to the gym at least 3 times a week. So how have you been?
(A) F: Not bad. You've lost much weight. You are so slim now. (B) F: Not bad. You look younger and thinner now. (C) F: I am sorry. You spoke so rapidly that I did not catch the meaning of what you said. Could you repeat that? (D) F: Not bad. You used to be thinner. I can't believe it.

M: I'd like some information about opening a savings account. ,F: A savings account? Certainly, what would you like to know? ,M: Could you tell me what the interest rate is? ,F: It's five and a quarter percent.
(A) M: Well, I don't want any information about opening a savings account in this hotel. Please stopping talking about it. (B) M: Really? It's four and a quarter percent? Oh, it's very low in this supermarket. (C) M: Okay, I see. I want some information about closing a savings account in this bank. (D) M: Just a minute! I do not quite follow what you are saying, would you mind repeating that?

M: Ah, that's the forth ad that appears suddenly on my computer screen since I started working on my paper. ,F: You can buy an app that will stop those ads. ,M: I can't afford to buy some fancy $10 software just so I can write my paper. ,F: It's not that expensive. It's $1 per month. ,M: So that's $12 a year. ,F: Is it going to take you a whole year to finish that essay? ,M: Well, no, Harriet. It'll be done in 3 weeks. But I'll be doing school work on this computer for 4 years before I graduate.
(A) F: I didn’t hear you. Please could you tell me again? (B) F: After you finished your essay in three weeks, you can change this computer. (C) F: So you have to put up with the kids until you finished your essay in one month. (D) F: You'll have finished your paper in three weeks and need not be bothered by the ad.

M: Don't tell me you're bored already? ,F: Well, yeah, I am. ,M: We just got here. You will have to find a way to entertain yourself then. ,F: What can I do? There are just a bunch of boring people giving boring speeches.
(A) M: You are right. It is too hot in the room and we have spent a whole day here. (B) M: I didn’t hear you. Please could you tell me again? (C) M: Since we have been here for one day, you must find the speeches are very boring. (D) M: That is true. The speeches are boring to you. You can entertain yourself then.

F: Jason, you are recovering so quickly. You look much better today. I think you'll be home in a few days. ,M: I hope so. Then I'll be able to play in the football match next month. I've been looking forward to that day.
(A) F: OK, you can go on playing on the playground now. (B) F: OK. But remember to close the door when you leave the office. (C) F: But you still need to stay in the hospital now. (D) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t understand. Could you repeat a little louder, please?

F: Come in, Bob. Did you have trouble getting here? ,M: No, I just followed the directions on my phone. Hey, this is a nice place. ,F: Thanks. I'm enjoying it, coffee? ,M: Sure, thanks. So are you ok, Sylvia? You look upset. ,F: Oh, I'm ok. I was up all night long working on my Chinese. ,M: That's too bad, you know, I found a new way to learn Chinese and it's fun. ,F: You did? Please tell me, I've spent months trying to learn Chinese like you. But it seems I've never made any progress.
(A) M: So you have learnt Chinese for several months. (B) M: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Could you say it again? (C) M: So you have learnt French for one month. (D) M: So you have learnt French for two weeks.

F: Would you like to order now, sir? ,M: Yes, please. I like the steak and mushrooms.
(A) F: OK. Let's take a lunch break to have something to eat. (B) F: Sure. Do you need anything else? We have special drinks today. (C) F: OK. You'll have steak and potatoes. Anything else? (D) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please?

M: Mary, how often do you watch TV? ,F: I watched the news or music programs in the morning. And when I come home at night, I sometimes watch films on TV.
(A) M: Yeah, watching films in the morning is great. (B) M: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch that. Would you mind speaking more slowly? (C) M: That's great. The news at night is very interesting. Nobody will see the news in the morning. (D) M: Great! I have the same habit because I never see the music programs.

F: Look at this ad, computers 70% off. I'm going to order one. ,M: Sounds too good to be true. If I were you I'd get more information before giving them any money.
(A) F: Why do you suggest that I ignore this advertisement? This advertisement says that computers are 50% off. (B) F: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Could you say it again? (C) F: Why do you suggest me to get more information first? This advertisement says that computers are 50% off! (D) F: So you suggest me to get more information first, right?

M: Hi Daisy. ,F: Hi Tom. I hope you are getting on well at college. ,M: I am. I've made lots of friends and I really enjoy my courses. ,F: Great. Me, too. So what do you like most about our college? ,M: I especially like the swimming pool. ,F: Yes, me too. The school gym and the playground are very good. Oh, you didn't tell me what you are studying there. ,M: I'm doing business studies. I hope to get a job in Toronto after graduating since that's where my parents live now.
(A) F: Wow, cool. So you are in Canberra now. (B) F: Wow, cool. So you are in Toronto now. (C) F: Wow, cool. So your father is in Sydney now. (D) F: Excuse me, could you repeat the question?

M: Do you like to go to the zoo on Sunday? ,F: Yes, I like to go to the zoo. But not on Sundays, because it's always so crowded. How about going on a Friday or Saturday?
(A) M: So you don't like going to the zoo on Sundays, do you? (B) M: So you don't like to go to the zoo on Fridays because it's crowded, right? (C) M: So you don't like going to the zoo on Sundays and Saturdays, do you? (D) M: I didn’t hear you. Please could you tell me again?

F: Are you busy this week? ,M: Yes. This morning I need to write a business report and this afternoon at 1:30, I'll discuss the report with the general manager. ,F: What's your schedule for tomorrow? ,M: I'm attending the sales meeting at 9 o'clock and in the afternoon at 3:00, I'm seeing Mr .Black, the marketing manager. ,F: What about Wednesday? ,M: I've got an appointment at 8:30 with Mr. Anderson, the bank manager. In the afternoon, I'm taking the 4:45 flight to Hong Kong for the conference.
(A) F: I still remember my last meeting with Mr. Anderson. He is a brilliant general manager. (B) F: Wish you have a pleasant appointment with the greatest marketing manager in the world. (C) F: Mr. Anderson is a very brilliant bank manager. What a lucky guy you are! (D) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch that. Would you mind speaking more slowly?

F: Are there any public telephones in the school? ,M: Not many. Most students have cell phones. I think there's one in the student center.
(A) F: Thanks. I'll look for the public phone by myself. (B) F: Thanks. I'll look for the Student Center by myself. (C) F: Thanks. I'll look for the cell phone by myself. (D) F: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it.

F: Why, Bob, your poor leg? Can you tell me what happened? ,M: I broke it when I was giving a long shots in the football game yesterday. ,F: I'm very sorry about that.
(A) M: Yes, I broke my leg. (B) M: Yes, I was shot in the leg. (C) M: Just a minute! I do not quite follow what you are saying, would you mind repeating that? (D) M: What a shame. I lost a game.

M: Look at this white mark, you've ruined my table. How am I ever going to make it look nice again? ,F: Relax, I know how to do it. All we need is some wood oil, and some hard work to rub it in.
(A) M: OK. Let's paint the walls white. (B) M: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it. (C) M: Well. We are going to buy a new one. (D) M: Let's get rid of the mark on the table to remove the green mark.

M: How long will I have to stay out of school. ,F: About a week. You still have a fever.
(A) M: Really? About two weeks? So, I need to stay out of school because I has got a cold? (B) M: I’m sorry, I didn’t understand. Could you repeat a little louder, please? (C) M: OK, I see. I need to stay out of school about a month because I has got a fever. (D) M: Okay. You mean I have no fever but I has got flu. So, I need to stay out of school.

M: Hello, computer consultants. ,F: Hello, I'm interested in the Nova computer. ,M: The basic model or the basic plus? ,F: Which one is more suitable for a small restaurant? ,M: Well, it depends on what you really need. Both of them have the latest and greatest hardware. ,F: Well, we do need a wide range of software. ,M: Then I think you should consider the basic plus. ,F: Do you supply software? ,M: No, we don't supply any software. But we can recommend suppliers. And there's a training program with both models. We also run special courses for new users. ,F: That sounds impressive.
(A) M: If you buy Nova Basic as I said, your restaurant will run more efficiently. (B) M: Excuse me, could you repeat the question? (C) M: We sell software and you sell computers, so we can collaborate well. (D) M: Your training courses are popular as you know Nova computers well.

M: Lucy, you're back. What classes did you have? ,F: Well, I had English from 9:00 to 10:30, art from 13:30 to 15:00. And math from 15:45 to 17:15.
(A) M: Okay, so you had English class at 14:00. (B) M: I didn’t hear you. Please could you tell me again? (C) M: Okay, so you had Art class at 10:00. (D) M: Okay, so you had Art class at 14:00.

F: Mike, what did Tim say just now? ,M: He said it'll rain this afternoon. ,F: Really? But it's such a beautiful day.
(A) M: It is sunny now, but it may rain in the afternoon. (B) M: Yes. It is going to rain all day. (C) M: I am sorry. You spoke so rapidly that I did not catch the meaning of what you said. Could you repeat that? (D) M: Yes. It is cloudy now and maybe raining in the afternoon.

M: Mary, I'm going to London tomorrow. ,F: Oh, yes. Are you going by bus? ,M: It's the best way. There is a fast train but it's too expensive for me.
(A) F: So, you will travel to London by car because there is no fast train? (B) F: OK, I see. You mean there is a fast train and it's too cheap for you, so you will travel to London by train. (C) F: OK, I see. Since it's too expensive for you, you will travel to London by bus the day after tomorrow. (D) F: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Could you say it again?

F: Did you see today's newspaper? That building over there in center view was just struck by lightning for the fourth time. ,M: I'm not surprised. If the conditions for lightning to strike are right one time, they might be as good another time. ,F: Well, I don't take any chances. If I'm caught in a thunderstorm, I will look for a building or a closed car. Also, I was told that if you're stuck outdoors, the best thing you can do is to keep yourself close to the ground and avoid bodies of water.
(A) M: Well, you are right, stand on the ground is the only way to avoid thunder striking. (B) M: Yes, I agree with you that you should go to a swimming pool when it is thunderstorms. (C) M: Yes, you'd better to find a house to avoid thunder striking when you were caught in a thunderstorm. (D) M: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Could you say it again?

M: Good evening, ma'am. Do you have a reservation? ,F: No, I don't. ,M: Awfully sorry, but there are no empty tables left now.
(A) F: You mean there are no empty tables in the shop even if I had a reservation. (B) F: The restaurant is awful. We still don't have table on condition that I had a reservation. (C) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch that. Would you mind speaking more slowly? (D) F: The restaurant is really crowded.

M: Ma'am! You forgot your phone. ,F: Oh, thanks. I couldn't live without this little thing. ,M: I know what you mean. It is of great significance to you. So, did you enjoy your dinner?
(A) F: Oh, yes. It's strange. I never forget my phone anywhere. (B) F: Oh, yes, I want to thank you again. The phone is extremely important to me. (C) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t understand. Could you repeat a little louder, please? (D) F: Oh, yes. I really enjoy the service with my phone.

F: Could I use your computer, David? ,M: Sorry, Mary. Mine's broken. You can use Bill's or Bob's.
(A) F: Sorry to hear that. Your computer is broken. (B) F: Excuse me, could you repeat the question? (C) F: Bob's computer is broken. Could I use your computer, David? (D) F: Sorry to hear that. Your TV is broken.

F: You look terrible, did you have a car accident? ,M: Well, not exactly. This morning I went to deliver milk, and the garden gate of No. 12 was locked. There was a note on the door of the house, and I thought I couldn't read it from where I was. ,F: What happened next? ,M: I jumped over the fence and went towards the door. And suddenly, as I was trying to read that note, a huge dog rushed at me. I started running as fast as I could, but I didn't see that... ,F: What?
(A) M: I didn’t hear you. Please could you tell me again? (B) M: I jumped over the fence to read the note. (C) M: I jumped over the fence to deliver milk. (D) M: I jumped over the fence to lock the door.

F: I will drive to the meeting hall. Will you go with me? ,M: Thank you. But I have to finish my paper. I'll walk to the underground station and go there by underground.
(A) F: OK, but I need to tell you that it will be tired if you really choose to go the meeting hall on foot. (B) F: I’m sorry, I didn’t understand. Could you repeat a little louder, please? (C) F: OK, and it is indeed convenient to go to the shopping mall by underground. (D) F: OK, and it is indeed convenient to go to the meeting hall by underground.

F: In Britain, we are often told that people are leaving the big cities to live in the countryside, but is this the same worldwide? ,M: Not at all. If you look at the biggest cities in one thousand nine hundred and fifty, 7 out of the top 10 were in the developed countries. But by the year two thousand, the developing countries will have 8 out of top 10. New York, which in one thousand nine hundred and fifty, was number one with a population of around 12,000,000 will only be the sixth the largest city in the world, but with an extra 2 million.
(A) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please? (B) F: New York has a population of 14 million in 2000! It had a population of only 10 million in 1950. (C) F: So New York's population could be 14 million in 2000, right? (D) F: New York had a population of only 10 million in 1950, and 26 million in 2000! It's amazing.

F: Tom, what are you going to do this weekend? ,M: I have no idea. Usually I stay at home and watch TV. Sometimes I play computer games. Do you have any good ideas? ,F: Let's go to the cinema. I haven't seen a movie for a long time. I heard Ice Age 4 is really popular. Let's go and see it. ,M: Oh, I'm not really interested in cartoons. How about playing tennis at the gym? ,F: OK. I like sports. When and where shall we meet? ,M: Let's meet at the gym at 9:00 o'clock on Saturday morning. ,F: OK. See you then. ,M: See you.
(A) F: Yes, Professor Wang. I understood this issue. (B) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please? (C) F: Don't be late man or you will lose me as your friend. (D) F: No honey. I won't play tennis with you. I am tired.

M: Hey, Tina! How's the Spanish course going? ,F: Tough. Our teacher is using a lot of authentic material. You know, stuff off the radio and TV, he even tapes conversations with his friends and uses them in class.
(A) M: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it. (B) M: Well, that's right the Spanish course is pretty easy, that's because as you mentioned the teacher would never use authentic material. (C) M: Yeah, I know the Spanish course is very difficult, but luckily the teacher has never used the authentic material. (D) M: Oh, so the Spanish course is not that kind of difficult and it is just so-so, I guess that's because the teacher never use authentic material in his class.

F: Professor Jones, you're a well-known professor of mathematics at the City College. May I ask you a few questions about your favorite hobby? ,M: Sure, I like collecting coins the most. ,F: How long have you been collecting coins? ,M: Since I was 12 years old when my uncle gave me a book with spaces to put coins into. ,F: How did your interest grow? ,M: I finished that book one year later and continued to search for rare and old ones. ,F: Where do you find your coins? ,M: Sometimes I get them from a small shops but I usually buy them from other People who collect coins.
(A) F: Can I ask how many you've spent on buying coins from amateurs? (B) F: Can I ask that which small shop of stamps you usually go? (C) F: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it. (D) F: Can I ask that how you found the other stamps collectors?

F: Excuse me, sir, can you help me? I need to buy a bed for my new apartment. ,M: Of course, what size bed do you need? ,F: It's a small apartment so I don't want anything too big. ,M: Well, you should get a twin bed. That's the smallest size for an adult. It only fits one person. A bigger size bed is a double bed for 2 people. Then there are queen size and king size beds. Those are very large. There are much too big for you. ,F: OK. Thanks so much I'll get the smallest one.
(A) M: Sorry, we don't have any apartment with twin bed. (B) M: OK. This is the key for the apartment with a twin bed. (C) M: Excuse me, could you repeat the question? (D) M: Sorry, we don't have a queen-sized bed like you asked.

M: It was very nice of you to invite me. ,F: I'm very glad you could come, Doctor Wong. What would you like? ,M: This is my first time at a Chinese restaurant. Could you tell me the different features of Chinese food? ,F: Generally speaking, Beijing food is a bit oily. Shanghai food is rather light and Hunan dishes are very spicy.
(A) M: Haha, I've been here before, so I know that Beijing meals have a light taste. (B) M: You must like the light taste of Shanghai food, so I invite you here to try it. (C) M: Just a minute! I do not quite follow what you are saying, would you mind repeating that? (D) M: Oh, yes. Hunan meals have a light taste and Shanghai food is very spicy.

F: Don't you think Manny's radio is too loud? ,M: Yes, I do. I can't even read my book. Ask him to turn it down, please.
(A) F: I can't agree more. Manny should read more magazines instead of listening to the radio quietly. (B) F: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Could you say it again? (C) F: I don't think the radio is too noisy. (D) F: No problem. He doesn't even realize that the radio is too loud and disturbing.

F: Hey, Joe. Do you think it's going to rain today? ,M: Well, see the dark clouds over there. It's very likely, but the weather forecast says it's going to be a good day. I think they will make another mistake this time.
(A) F: I agree with you. There is no dark cloud and today is a fine day! (B) F: Just a minute! I do not quite follow what you are saying, would you mind repeating that? (C) F: I am not surprised that the there are many dark clouds, because the weather forecast says it's will be rainy. (D) F: Yeah, as there is no dark cloud, today will be cloudy and warm.

M: Let's discuss your education background. You were an English major, weren't you? ,F: Yes, that's right. But I liked French best. ,M: Fine, and could you tell me what kind of work experience you've had? ,F: My last position was with Lumison Marten. That was from two thousand and five to two thousand and nine. That's a law firm in Sacramento. Before that I worked for a bishop in Baldwin. That was from two thousand and three to two thousand and five.
(A) M: So you worked for about 9 years in the last company that situated in London. (B) M: So you worked for about 4 years in the last company that situated in London. (C) M: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it. (D) M: So you worked for about 4 years in the last company.

F: Look how thin the mommy is. And she had a baby only 6 months ago. ,M: Yeah, my wife gets really depressed when she sees mom's like that. She had our daughter 2 years ago and she still can't lose weight.
(A) F: So your daughter is 1 years old and your wife lost weight one year ago? (B) F: Wow, your daughter is already 2 years old. (C) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please? (D) F: Then your daughter is 3 years old and your wife has lost weight two years ago, right?

F: I notice an article in the newspaper about the problem of rapid growth of cities in America. I was wondering do you Americans carry out a birth control policy? Can Americans have as many children as they want? ,M: Yes, sir. We can have as many as we want, but most people decide to have only one or 2, and some people decide not to have any.
(A) F: I am afraid I did not quite catch what you were saying. Please repeat it. (B) F: The cities are growing, but you don't know if there is birth control policy in America, do you? (C) F: Since the population is not growing in America, it's understandable to have no birth control policy. (D) F: Although the cities are growing rapidly, you don't have birth control policy in America, right?

M: Mary, what's that there in your hand? A ring? ,F: Yes, you are right. It's a birthday gift for my grandma. ,M: But you only gave me a jacket for my birthday last week.
(A) F: This is a ring for my grandma. (B) F: I am sorry. You spoke so rapidly that I did not catch the meaning of what you said. Could you repeat that? (C) F: I gave you a ring for your birthday last week. (D) F: I will send this jacket as a birthday gift for my grandma.

M: Hi, Asha, is your mother feeling any better? ,F: No, I'm afraid not. She's very homesick. She misses her family and friends back in India.
(A) M: Oh my god. I'm so sorry your mom's sick. (B) M: I’m sorry, I didn’t catch that. Would you mind speaking more slowly? (C) M: Getting in touch with your family can ease your homesickness, can't it? (D) M: Oh, I'm sorry. It's hard to be homesick, isn't it?

M: I have to go to Professor Hudson's office to discuss my thesis. If time allows I'd like to go to the movies with you when I come back. ,F: I don't think I can make it. I'm going shopping with Jane right now.
(A) M: It's a pity. You know I must go to watch a movie first. (B) M: It's a pity. You know I must go to meet my teacher first. (C) M: It's a pity. You know I must go to do some shopping first. (D) M: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please?

M: Oh, look at the sky, Marie. It's starting to get cloudy. ,F: I thought it was going to be a fine day today. I hope it doesn't rain. ,M: We can't have our picnic without some good sunshine for all the eating and games and entertainment. ,F: Yeah, but not too much sunshine, Allen. Don't you remember last year? It was so hot. ,M: And no one wanted to participate in any of the planned activities. All we wanted was cold drinks. I remember that the temperature just climbed higher and higher that day.
(A) F: Yeah, you were so satisfied with the picnic and played games with everybody. (B) F: Just a minute! I do not quite follow what you are saying, would you mind repeating that? (C) F: Well, the weather was sunny and nice last year and everyone enjoyed playing games. (D) F: Yeah, they didn't want to play because it was so hot.

F: When I was a child, my ambition was to be a train driver. ,M: That isn't a suitable job for women. ,F: Yeah, well. My uncle drove a train and I wanted to be just like him. ,M: Why didn't you realize your dream? ,F: Well, my parents objected. Now of course, I realize that it's dangerous and extremely demanding. When I was in high school, I wanted to be a chemist. But I gave it up because my grades were bad. ,M: How do you feel about your nursing work here? ,F: It is badly paid and stressful, but I think it is rewarding to look after patients.
(A) M: Why do you think your work is dangerous? (B) M: I am glad that you think your work is rewarding and relaxing. (C) M: I am glad that you think your work is rewarding. (D) M: I’m sorry, I don’t understand. Could you say it again?

F: Good afternoon. May I help you, sir? ,M: Could you please change this note for me? ,F: Don't you want to buy anything in my shop? ,M: Sorry, I just need some change. I have got to phone someone.
(A) F: Look around and see what you want to buy. (B) F: Excuse me, could you repeat the question? (C) F: You can withdraw money from our bank. (D) F: Let me go back to my store and see if I could help you.

F: What on earth has happened to you? ,M: I tripped up when I was running in the park. I fell on a bit of tree or something. ,F: Let me see. It's quite a deep cut. You'd better wash it in the bathroom. ,M: Yeah, I will.
(A) F: I am really sorry, I did not catch that. Would you slow down, please? (B) F: You need to wash it in a hospital where you got hurt. (C) F: We are in our home now. So you need to wash it now and don't wait anymore. (D) F: I can't believe you hurt yourself in our home
